snippet: Mike Rizzo was upset that Phillies pitcher Cole Hamels hit the rookie Bryce Harper with a pitch and then said he deliberately plunked him.
abstract: MLB Roundup; Judge Reggie Walton lectures prosecutors and defense lawyers in perjury case against Roger Clemens that the proceedings are plodding along so slowly that jurors are losing interest; urges them to stop asking unnecessary questions and showing needless photographs; other baseball news and results noted. Photo (M)/
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- A federal judge presiding over the Roger Clemens perjury trial gave prosecutors and defense lawyers a stern talking to on Tuesday because the proceedings -- in their fourth week now -- were plodding along so slowly that the jurors were losing interest. ''Those folk are fed up because they see their time being wasted,'' the judge, Reggie Walton of United States District Court, said to the lawyers before the jury entered the courtroom.

headline.main: Slow Pace of Clemens Trial Is Boring Jurors, Judge Says
